Content:: Egidio Caporello (8 June 1931 – 18 July 2022) was an Italian Roman Catholic prelate. Caporello was ordained to the priesthood in 1955. He served in the Roman Curia from 1982 to 1986 and was ordained titular bishop of Caprulae. Caporello then served as bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Mantua, Italy, from 1986 until his retirement in 2007.[1][2]  This article about a Catholic bishop is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
